adjectives.description: forbidding (comparative more forbidding, superlative most forbidding)

entries.meaning: Appearing to be threatening, unfriendly or potentially unpleasant.
examples: The writer of the “blank” letter begins fluently with the date and “Dear Mary,” and then sits and chews his penholder or makes little dots and squares and circles on the blotter—utterly unable to attack the cold, forbidding blankness of that first page.

entries.meaning: The act by which something is forbidden; a prohibition.
examples: All law was composed of hindrances and obstacles and forbiddings, and therefore he was entirely opposed to Law.
